definitions: To cover (a wall or room) with wallpaper.
To cover or wrap in paper.
To provide (a person) with the necessary documents or identification.
To fill a position or organization with people, often excessively or unnecessarily.
examples: We need to paper the living room this weekend.
She will paper the gifts before the party.
The lawyer helped paper the new employees.
The company tends to paper its departments with too many managers.
